description: Greatest common divisor of two binomial coefficients formed from consecutive primes: a(n) = gcd(C(prime(n+2), prime(n+1)), C(prime(n+1), prime(n))).
formula: a(n) = GCD(f(n+1),f(n)) where f(n) = binomial(prime(n+1), prime(n)). (Pink box comment by Joerg Arndt, corrected).
maple: A058078:=n->gcd(binomial(ithprime(n+2),ithprime(n+1)), binomial(ithprime(n+1), ithprime(n))); seq(A058078(n), n=1..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Apr 01 2014
mathematica: GCD[Binomial[Last[#],#[[2]]],Binomial[#[[2]],First[#]]]&/@ Partition[ Prime[ Range[90]],3,1] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 05 2011 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n,p=prime(n))=my(q=nextprime(p+1),r=nextprime(q+1)); gcd(binomial(r,q), binomial(q,p)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 18 2015
author: _Labos Elemer_, Nov 13 2000
